content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function such that <math alttext="f of 9, equals 18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f prime of 9, equals 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></math>. If <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the function defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, the fraction with numerator f of x, and denominator the square root of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="g prime of 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
